page.title: 04 CHARLECOTE PARK & HOUSE(2)
page.content: The Library,built to house the collection started by the third Sir Thomas Lucy is now the third most important in the possession of the N.T. The lands extend to some 220 acres, but in the height of its prosperity, the family owned lands extending nearly to Coventry. The Park was landscaped in 1760 by Launcelot 'Capability' Brown. The Park supports herds of deer;the Fallow have been here for centuries,but the Red deer were introduced in the middle of the last century. In Shakespeare's time, the deer would have been the much smaller Roe deer. There is also a herd of Jacob sheep introduced over 200 years ago,and this year(1985) the former herd of cattle was replaced by a Charolais cross. The present tenant is Sir Edmund Cameron Ramsay Fairfax Lucy,6th baronet
